The identified loop structures in the given program are as follows:

1. Line 20: `for (w = 3; w; w -= 1)`

This loop iterates as long as the condition `w` is true, starting with `w` initialized to 3 and decrementing `w` by 1 in each iteration.

2. Line 21: `if (an = 250UL)`

This is not a loop structure but an `if` statement. However, it is nested within the previous `for` loop.

Therefore, the identified lines for the loops are `[20]`.


The final program in JSON format is as follows:

```json
{
  "program": "typedef short a;\n\
typedef int b;\n\
typedef long c;\n\
typedef char d;\n\
typedef unsigned f;\n\
\n\
d fn4(d p1, d p2) { return p1; }\n\
\n\
f p;\n\
b t;\n\
c v;\n\
a w;\n\
a ac = 1L;\n\
\n\
b fn13() {\n\
  b al = 3L;\n\
  c am = 1L;\n\
  b an;\n\
  for (w = 3; w; w -= 1)\n\
    if (an = 250UL) {\n\
      t = ac || (an = w) == 0x294A85636008822DLL;\n\
      a ao = 0xBCD1L;\n\
      if ((ao - fn4(am - an, 0xECL)) - t & 1UL)\n\
        v = 1UL;\n\
    }\n\
  return al;\n\
}\n\
\n\
int main() {\n\
  fn13();\n\
  p = v;\n\
  printf(\"checksum = %X\\n\", p);\n\
  return 0;\n\
}"
}
```

1. Line 19: for loop with the condition `for (w = 3; w; w -= 1)`
   - This loop iterates as long as the value of `w` is non-zero.
